task_summary: Perceive the T-shaped block and the goal region, approach and align the circular tool to a push face, push the block toward the goal, verify, perform a small corrective push if needed, then retreat.

task_long_description.overview: A UR-style arm with a cylindrical (circular) tool must push a red T-shaped block across a white tabletop into a marked goal region. The contact sheet shows approach from different sides, alignment near a block face, and progressive motion of the T. The behavior requires robust perception of both the block and the goal, accurate in-plane yaw alignment, and controlled push distances. Actions run at 10 Hz observation/control cadence with short timeouts. After an initial push, the robot verifies progress; if not yet in the goal, it executes a smaller corrective push, then retreats to clear the workspace.
preconditions: Workspace is clear except for the T-shaped block and goal outline.
Camera perception available for block and goal region.
Robot reachable poses cover the push path.
End-effector is a circular pusher; gripper not required.
stepwise_plan: Ensure the block (t_block) and goal region are visible or scan to find them.
Move above the block and align the tool to a pushable face with tight tolerance.
Set yaw to align push direction toward the goal.
Execute a primary push of moderate distance.
Re-perceive the scene; if not at goal, perform a shorter corrective push.
Retreat and wait briefly to finish.
success_criteria: Block is fully inside the goal region.
No collisions with table fixtures or robot self-collision.
End-effector disengages and retreats after completion.
failure_and_recovery: If the block or goal is not visible, raster-scan and retry perception.
If push slips or stops early, issue a shorter corrective push.
If alignment error detected, re-approach and realign before pushing.
task_long_description.termination: Terminate when the goal check passes and the robot has retreated from contact.

frame_3.now_evidence: first stable contact and alignment cue visible
frame_3.predicts_next: push actuation expected; confirms goal direction

task_instruction: The task requires pushing a T-shaped block (gray) to a fixed target (green) with a circular end-effector (blue). Both observation and control frequencies are 10Hz.

node_specs.description: Checks visibility of a named object or region.
Raster-scan to locate the target if not immediately visible.
Position tool above the block with a safe vertical offset.
Slide/approach to align the tool normal to a pushable face.
Rotate tool yaw to align pushing direction.
In-plane push of the block for a set distance and direction.
Update pose estimate of a named object/region.
Proxy goal-check that the object/pose is at the goal region.

failure_modes: Target or block not detected due to occlusion or glare
recovery_strategy: Fallback to raster scan when visibility checks fail
Re-approach and re-align before pushing again
Short corrective push sequence with verification
Retreat and replan if unexpected contact is sensed (future extension)
assumptions: Frames show a blue/cyan goal outline, while the instruction says green; we treat this as the same fixed target (goal_region).
Direction 90Â° (table +x) chosen from visual evidence of lateral pushes; exact world axes are symbolic.
10 Hz observation/control implied but not encoded as BT ports; timeouts chosen from allowed bins to fit short-horizon pushing.

expected_success_criteria: Block pose wholly inside goal region after corrective step and retreat
